categoryContent.paragraphOne: Wear a helmet. Many kids and adults think theyâ€™re stupid. Be really smart and look stupid in helmets. Brain damage is no joke.
If a loved one is taken in an ambulance, do not follow them to the hospital.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: Go there on your own time and own route.
categoryContent.paragraphThree: A good use of this time is to pack an overnight bag and to collect any valid medical information.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: If you have illegal drugs in your system and find yourself in the hospital please be honest and disclose exactly what you've taken or what you believe you've taken.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: Care providers are not the police and the quality of your outcome might depend on such information.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: Be skeptical of products that say 'clinically proven'.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: That is a marketing term and only says they've done their own private study that is designed to show the result the company wants.
categoryContent.paragraphThree: It is not the same as a 'scientifically proven' study which is published and open for peer review.

categoryContent.paragraphTwo: You use it every night and the difference between a good pillow and a stack of cheap ones is almost immediately noticeable.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: If you are hiking / running / walking with someone in a worse shape than you, let them lead the way.
